Question
========
In what circumstances do we use the “standardized” coefficient alpha instead of the raw coefficient alpha when calculating the Cronbach's alpha?


Solution
========
We use the “standardized” coefficient alpha instead of the raw coefficient alpha when the items in the test have different scales. For example some items are Likert items on a 7‐point scale while others are Likert items on a 5‐point scale.
